item.title: Nine self-harm hospitalisations in 12 months after new NT youth justice centre opened
item.description: Nine youths ended up in hospital after self-harming at Darwin's new $130 million detention centre in the 12 months after it opened, documents released to the ABC under Freedom of Information laws have revealed.

item.title: From truth-telling to closing the gap, First Nations leaders outline their priorities in 2026
item.description: Ahead of the national debate around Indigenous rights and recognition this January 26, the ABC has spoken to First Nations leaders about what they think are the top priorities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

item.title: Liberals wait on Hastie-Taylor decision before challenging Sussan Ley's leadership
item.description: Liberal leadership aspirants Andrew Hastie and Angus Taylor are being urged to "sort out" which of them will challenge Sussan Ley for the party's top job before a spill is called.

item.title: Novak Djokovic shows his love-hate relationship with Australian tennis fans is like no other
item.description: Novak Djokovic shows once again that his relationship with Australian tennis fans is as complicated as it gets, turning a routine win into a full-blown drama.

item.title: Stan Wawrinka says goodbye with a beer as Jannik Sinner is saved by the sun — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: Stan Wawrinka bowed out from the Australian Open with a tear in his eye and a beer in his hand, while a grumpy Novak Djokovic set an incredible new benchmark. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

item.title: Former state care kid calls for fundamental change to fix 'broken' residential care system
item.description: Residential care is often a last resort for society's most vulnerable children, but being raised by a "system" can leave both physical and emotional scars. It's why those who have gone through it are asking for their voices to be included to reform it.

item.title: Hard Quiz: Will this be the week you nail it? Nah, probably not
item.description: I applaud your repeated attempts to do well at this quiz. Will your desperation pay off?

item.title: Australia warned recovering Chinese tourism market may cool in 2026
item.description: Chinese visitor numbers have increased but are still below pre-pandemic levels, with economists warning ongoing economic uncertainty in China could dampen long-haul travel.

item.title: Australia Day event Aus Lights on the River cancelled in Adelaide
item.description: An annual Australia Day event in the Adelaide CBD has been cancelled ahead of potentially the hottest day in six years.

item.title: Sydney volunteers break barriers to music, sports events for disability community
item.description: For some, going to a music gig or sporting event alone can be daunting, but a Sydney volunteer program is empowering people with a disability to get out of their comfort zone.

item.title: Out-of-control bushfire in Victoria's Otways grows as state faces record temperatures on Tuesday
item.description: An out-of-control bushfire has threatened communities in Victoria's Otways, as heatwave conditions continue in some parts of the state.

item.title: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Luana downgraded to tropical low after impacting Dampier Peninsula
item.description: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Luana is downgraded to a tropical low as it continues inland after crossing the northern WA coast.

item.title: Mother shares tribute to 15-year-old Max trapped under Mount Maunganui landslide
item.description: After two days of holding out hope despite all the odds, the local police superintendent had the heart-wrenching job of announcing that no-one trapped by the landslide at Mount Maunganui could have survived.

item.title: Police chief calls for calm after man killed during Minneapolis immigration crackdown
item.description: This is the second fatal shooting involving federal agents this month during a surge in immigration enforcement in the northern US city.

item.title: Rod Laver’s father built him a backyard tennis court 80 years ago. Now locals are battling to save it
item.description: Like Donald Bradman’s tank stand, the backyard tennis court of Rod Laver’s youth has survived against the odds, but it is yet to be heritage listed.

item.title: Searching for Celine: How YouTube filmmaker Rob Parsons helped the search for missing tourist Celine Cremer
item.description: Rob Parsons amassed a following on YouTube for his videos of remote gold panning and mineral fossicking. Now, his attention is on the search for missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer.

item.title: Moment federal officers shoot man dead in Minneapolis
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Kondoli Dreaming brings Ramindjeri and Ngarrindjeri knowledge to firefighting
item.description: A new fire response vehicle in South Australia's Fleurieu Peninsula has been named after a Dreaming story about a powerful whale man that explores the creation of fire, paying homage to tens of thousands of years of local fire management knowledge.

item.title: Iranian protesters chant for a 'revolution' after years of economic chaos
item.description: Decades of economic mismanagement and government corruption have widened wealth gaps in Iran, leaving ordinary Iranians calling for a revolution.

item.title: How moving overseas changed my shopping habits
item.description: Amid all the adventure and growth, I've noticed a surprisingly quiet shift I didn't expect: my relationship with shopping.

item.title: People involved in Runt movie grappling with how to feel after author Craig Silvey charged
item.description: As one of Australia's most renowned authors faces child exploitation material charges, the town where one of his children's books was turned into a motion picture is grappling with the news.

item.title: PM says Trump's insult to troops 'not acceptable', as he names Greg Moriarty next ambassador to the US
item.description: Defence department boss Greg Moriarty is named the next ambassador to the United States, as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese criticises the US president's claim that allied troops did not serve on the front lines of Afghanistan.

item.title: Protests erupt after second deadly shooting by federal agents in Minneapolis
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Bangladesh officially withdraws from T20 World Cup as Scotland wins last-minute call-up
item.description: After weeks of uncertainty, Bangladesh officially withdraws from next month's T20 World Cup due to security concerns, with Scotland called in for the tournament.

item.title: De Minaur demolishes Bublik to storm into quarterfinal date with Alcaraz
item.description: Alex de Minaur obliterates Alexander Bublik in straight sets on Rod Laver Arena, after superstars Aryna Sabalenka and Carlos Alcaraz progressed through to the last eight of the Australian Open.

item.title: Why easing demand for illegal cigarettes will be a win-win situation for WA government
item.description: Much has been made of how the WA government is trying to stop the supply of illegal cigarettes, but its more difficult challenge is what can be done to ease demand.

item.title: Prince Harry takes the Daily Mail to the High Court, but some say the result will be a judgement on him
item.description: This week, Prince Harry traded the sunny West Coast for London to give evidence in a "super claim" against the publishers of the Daily Mail and the Mail on Sunday, Associated Newspapers.

item.title: British dual citizen shares concerns about middleman websites overcharging for passport renewals
item.description: As many British-Australian dual nationals grapple with new entry requirements, experts warn of exploitative and middleman websites.

item.description: A health warning was issued to Melbourne residents as the city was covered in smoke from a bushfire burning in the Otways, in Victoria's south-west.

item.description: Rumours of a probe swirled last week after military officials Zhang Youxia and Liu Zhenli appeared to miss a meeting chaired by Xi Jinping.

item.title: Sharn Davidson is living with Tourette syndrome and uses dinosaurs to educate others about differences
item.description: Sharn has two dinosaurs inside her — one is called Kevin and the other Terry. Here's how she handles it when they roar unexpectedly.

item.title: Donald Trump praises UK troops as 'brave' warriors after widespread condemnation
item.description: The US President has praised British soldiers, after remarks he made earlier this week about NATO troops in Afghanistan were described as "insulting and appalling" by the UK's Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

item.title: Queensland family trades cattle breeding for steak searing
item.description: A Queensland family is trading decades of purebred cattle breeding for life in the kitchen, selling off 20 years of stud work to focus on a new paddock-to-plate restaurant.

item.description: A large-scale search is underway in the Mount Hope district after a possible sighting of the alleged triple murderer overnight.

item.description: A monster snowstorm is moving across the US, cancelling thousands of flights, knocking out power and snarling major roadways with ice.

item.title: New era dawns in Australian cricket as Big Bash generation steps up

item.title: Bull shark tagging and extra drones for NSW beaches following attacks

item.description: Has your bedtime routine gone out the window over the school holidays? We've got you covered with these expert tips.

item.title: Flash flooding on Copperfield River forces emergency evacuation of Einasleigh
item.description: Etheridge Shire Council in Far North Queensland issues an Emergency Warning for Einasleigh township residents to evacuate.

item.title: Brandan Koschel denied bail over alleged hate speech at March for Australia rally
item.description: Brandan Koschel has been charged with publicly inciting hatred on the grounds of race causing fear after he made comments at an open mic session at the rally.

item.title: Japan says goodbye to its last pandas as relations with Beijing deteriorate
item.description: The departure of the last pandas from Japan demonstrates a significant crisis in North-East Asian politics that has no resolution on the horizon.

item.title: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter joins calls to boycott men's World Cup games in US
item.description: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter is backing a proposed fan boycott of men's World Cup matches in the United States because of the conduct of President Donald Trump and his administration.

item.title: Should you leave the air con on for your pets?
item.description: Do you wonder what your pet gets up to at home when you're not there? With temperatures on the rise, we asked three experts about keeping them cool in the heat.

item.title: Sink or Swim | Michael Klim
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Mandurah teacher who had student's baby pleads guilty to sexual abuse
item.description: A WA teacher pleads guilty to sexually abusing a boy who police say fathered her baby.

item.title: Time-lapse of winter storm at New York's Times Square
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Donald Trump triggers a gold rush as investors flee the United States
item.description: While the surging gold price has been a surprise, the driving forces behind it are not. Investors are losing faith in the United States and its role as the standard-bearer for global capitalism.

item.title: Victorian maximum temperature record broken as heatwave engulfs Australia
item.description: Temperatures soar to record highs across Victoria's north-west, as a heatwave pushes town gauges beyond previous records.

item.title: Charges withdrawn against seven men accused of illegally trafficking abalone on NSW South Coast
item.description: Seven Aboriginal men from the NSW South Coast, accused of illegally trafficking thousands of blacklip abalone, walk free after police prosecutors withdraw all charges.

item.title: Riverland town rises above 49C in 'new all-time record' for Renmark
item.description: Temperatures in Renmark soared above 49 degrees Celsius in what the weather bureau says is "a new all-time record" as the SA premier came to the aid of two boys who fainted during a media conference.

item.title: Three families on how they manage multi-generational living
item.description: Cost-of-living and housing affordability issues are bringing generations together under the same roof, but some families are doing it by choice.

item.title: Nowra man Joshua Stephen Davey arrested over alleged nitazines
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Immigration was at the centre of Donald Trump's 2024 win, but it's now mired in controversy
item.description: If there was one policy area that was at the centre of US President Donald Trump's election win in 2024, it was immigration. But it has now become mired in controversy.

item.title: Invasion Day 'explosive' device hidden inside Disney Frozen sock, witness says
item.description: A homemade "fragment bomb" thrown into a crowd at a Perth Invasion Day rally yesterday was hidden in a child's sock with a Disney character on it, a woman who picked it up tells the ABC.

item.title: Adelaide man charged with Victor Harbor attempted murder denied bail
item.description: A 20-year-old man remains in an induced coma after being stabbed "no less than 10 times" at a hotel in Victor Harbor, on South Australia's Fleurieu Peninsula. Warning: This story contains content some readers may find distressing.

item.title: Tamworth was once the National Party's heartland but with Barnaby Joyce's move, support for One Nation is taking hold
item.description: Support for One Nation is rising and in former National Party heartland, people gathered for a music festival have told us why.

item.title: Young driver worked more than 18 hours for Yole harness racing stables before 2023 crash, court hears
item.description: A driver crashed a vehicle towing a horse float after working for more than 18 hours, a Tasmanian court has heard, in a case in which a prominent harness racing stable is accused of failing to comply with its workplace health and safety duty.

item.title: Footage captured by locals in the Torres Strait
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: CCTV footage from a resort on Roko Island
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Foreign fishermen enter Queensland island resort before border force intercept
item.description: CCTV captures foreign fishermen landing on a Far North Queensland island resort and asking the bar for refreshments, before their boat is intercepted by the border force.

item.title: Police release images of ute last seen being driven by Lake Cargelligo shooting suspect Julian Ingram
item.description: NSW Police have released images of a white ute which was last seen being driven by Julian Ingram, who is wanted in connection with the fatal shooting of three people in Lake Cargelligo.

item.title: Independent probe on 'missed opportunities' for deadly NZ landslide
item.description: An independent probe will explore whether there was a "missed opportunity" to prevent six deaths caused by a landslide in New Zealand.

item.title: Historic heatwave sets all-time records as temperatures exceed 49C
item.description: The heatwave gripping south-east Australia reached day four on Tuesday and is now unprecedented in many regions.

item.title: Glenorchy City Council knocks back a proposal from Hobart to merge
item.description: Tasmania is a small place with many councils, 29 in fact. A proposal to merge Hobart with neighbouring Glenorchy has been knocked back with the latter saying it would be too costly and there's no community support for it.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Tensions in Minnesota could send the US into another government shutdown — here's why
item.description: Politicians across the spectrum in the US are looking for ways forward as public outrage intensifies in Minnesota. From a border czar to a partial government shutdown, here's what could come next.

item.title: New South Wales man stands trial on multiple charges for indecently dealing with two WA girls
item.description: The trial of New South Wales man Gregory Carr, accused of indecently dealing with two girls aged 12 and 13, is underway at a West Australian District Court.

item.title: Video shows man throwing explosive device into Perth Invasion Day rally crowd
item.description: WA Police have released CCTV that shows a man, dressed in black and wearing a black face mask, running through the crowd after throwing an object from a shopping centre balcony.

item.title: Anthony Albanese rules out blocking appointment of incoming NT administrator David Connolly
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says he will not intervene to block the appointment of the NT's incoming administrator, after a series of his past social media posts surfaced in the media.

item.title: Advocate believes system is broken after another death in custody in Kalgoorlie-Boulder
item.description: WA Police Commissioner Col Blanch tells the ABC he understands the recent death of a man in police custody in Kalgoorlie-Boulder, 600 kilometres east of Perth, was a "self-harm" issue, but investigations are ongoing.

item.title: Homes feared lost in Otways bushfire amid extreme fire danger in Victoria
item.description: Firefighters have been working through the night to contain a major fire in Victoria's Otway Ranges that was "running hard and fast" after a wind change on Tuesday.

item.title: Coco Gauff calls for greater privacy at Australian Open after racquet smash clip goes viral
item.description: Coco Gauff loses her cool in the tunnels of Melbourne Park, only for it to be broadcast around the world on live TV.

item.title: What is in the EU-India trade deal and what does it mean for global trade?
item.description: The agreement could impact nearly 2 billion people in both economies and comes amid an upheval in global trade stemming from Donald Trump's tariff policies.

item.title: BAFTAs nominations: Rose Byrne, Jacob Elordi lead the Aussie charge
item.description: The Australian hopefuls are nominated in the acting categories, but One Battle After Another leads the field with fourteen nods.

item.title: Trump administration sued by families over deadly Venezuelan boat strike
item.description: Families of two men allege they were murdered in a US missile strike off Venezuela's coast while returning to the Caribbean island nation of Trinidad.

item.title: Three brothers among 35 killed as freezing conditions grip US
item.description: Much of the US was not forecast to get above freezing all day on Tuesday, local time, with temperatures plunging again overnight.

item.title: Hottest 100 of 2025 — how well do you know this year's countdown?
item.description: The Hottest 100 is done for another year. Were you paying attention?

item.title: Why time feels like it speeds up as we age
item.description: The perception that time is flying by can sometimes make us feel stressed and anxious. So how do we slow it down?

item.title: Liberty Bell Bay looks for new use for manganese by-product, after environmental authority intervention
item.description: Liberty Bell Bay is considering how to use a manganese by-product, after concerns were raised by Tasmania's Environment Protection Authority.

item.title: National medicines database promised after telehealth 'doctor-shopping' leads to overdose
item.description: The tragic death of a young Melbourne woman who was stockpiling medication has prompted the federal health minister to move to change the way prescriptions are recorded.

item.title: Police reject claim March for Australia organiser was bashed by Middle Eastern men
item.description: March for Australia claims one of its organisers was bashed by a group of Middle Eastern men the day before Australia Day, but police and an eyewitness account have cast doubt on its claim.

item.title: Albanese government turns defence sights north, completing $355m upgrade to RAAF Base Tindal
item.description: A Royal Australian Air Force base near Katherine in the NT is updated with purpose-built hangars and improved runways.

item.title: Australia's heatwave smashes temperature records with some places nearing 50C
item.description: The Australian Open is off to a cooler start today after parts of Melbourne buckled under 45-degree heat yesterday, in a heatwave setting historic temperature records across the country's south-east.

item.title: Search for alleged triple murderer Julian Ingram may be like 'finding a needle in a haystack'
item.description: A former deputy commissioner of police who was involved in the eight-year search for one of Australia's most notorious fugitives says finding alleged Lake Cargelligo triple murderer Julian Ingram will be difficult.

item.title: Sydney's landfills are set to reach capacity by 2030 sparking controversial plans to take trash to the regions
item.description: A proposal to build an incinerator in the regional town of Parkes could see 700,000 tonnes of Sydney's red bin rubbish transported there every year.

item.title: ICE deported a man charged over the 'largest jewellery heist in US history' before he could face trial
item.description: An Ecuadorian man accused of aiding the theft of about $147 million worth of gold, gems and luxury watches was deported by the Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency before he could face trial.

item.title: Andrew and Tristan Tate lose bid to sue Adelaide YouTuber, launch appeal
item.description: An Australian YouTuber who is being sued by Andrew and Tristan Tate in a Florida court has won a bid to have the case dismissed, a decision the self-described misogynist influencers are now appealing.

item.title: Fugitive property developer Jean Nassif subject of ICAC probe over former Parramatta council bribe claims
item.description: The New South Wales corruption watchdog is examining allegations fugitive property developer Jean Nassif sought to bribe members of a former Parramatta council.

item.title: Scientists warn microplastics testing could be overestimating extent in human body
item.description: Queensland researchers lead calls for a standardised approach to microplastics testing, amid growing concerns about the impact of the pollutants on the human body.

item.title: How Queensland parents can get a free $100 for every school kid
item.description: Families can now get $100 per child in primary school to help with the cost of living, but there are a few rules around how you get it.

item.title: Alex de Minaur receives feedback from Carlos Alcaraz after Australian Open loss
item.description: Alex de Minaur acknowledges he needs improvement in his game, as Carlos Alcaraz moves on to the Australian Open semifinals.

item.title: Documents reveal widespread misconduct, complaints, at Busy Bees childcare centres in Canberra
item.description: Disturbing allegations of verbal and physical mistreatment of toddlers, poor supervision and repeated staffing failures have emerged in documents about Busy Bees childcare centres in Canberra.

item.title: Aryna Sabalenka's weird ritual, Carlos Alcaraz shows off — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka discussed why she writes on her coach's head before a match and Alexander Zverev shared an important message. Here are the quick hits from day 10 at the Australian Open.

item.title: Tropical low triggers flood evacuations in the north as extreme heat builds in Queensland's south‑west
item.description: A tropical low has dumped hundreds of millimetres of rain across North Queensland, prompting evacuations and cutting off communities, while the state's south-west braces for temperatures near 49C in a severe heatwave.

item.title: Sydney Festival 2026: Our favourite shows from Lacrima to Wake
item.description: A debauched Irish wake, a three-hour French play about a royal wedding dress and British electro-pop band Hot Chip were some of the best of the festival.

item.title: Shooting involving Border Patrol near US–Mexico border leaves person in critical condition
item.description: One person has been shot and is in critical condition after a shooting involving the Border Patrol near the US–Mexico border, authorities in Arizona say.

item.title: Live: Firefighters work to contain Victorian blazes as heatwave continues
item.description: Residents near a bushfire in southern Victoria face a nervous wait, while a heatwave that sent temperatures into the high 40s yesterday is set to impact parts of NSW and Queensland. Follow our live coverage.

item.title: Live: Lib senator backs debate on Morrison's call for intervention in Islamic teaching
item.description: A contentious Scott Morrison proposal for an intervention in Islamic teaching is a "worthwhile discussion to have" in the wake of the Bondi terror attack. Follow live.

item.title: Rado Vidisic, A-League title winning coach and Australian football figure, dies aged 64
item.description: Rado Vidosic, a highly-regarded Australian football figure and coach across a number of A-League clubs and teams, dies of cancer aged 64.

item.title: Daughter of Bondi terror attack victim says father Alex Kleytman spent his life fighting antisemitism
item.description: Sabina Kleitman grew up knowing little about how her father survived the Holocaust as a child. Now she sees parallels between the horrors of World War II and his death at Bondi.

item.title: Carlos Alcaraz approaching 'unmatchable' level after mastering powers of concentration
item.description: Twelve months ago, Carlos Alcaraz was outwitted by a hobbled Novak Djokovic. This time around, against a rampaging hometown hero, there would be no slipping up.

item.title: Minnesota judge orders ICE head to face court as Trump looks to wind down operation
item.description: A Minnesota judge takes the extraordinary step of ordering the acting director of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) to appear in person and explain why his agency keeps ignoring court orders.

item.title: Floor collapse at Toll warehouse causes statewide vaccine shortages
item.description: A section of floor has caved-in at Queensland's only vaccine warehouse, causing statewide delays to childhood vaccination schedules.

item.title: Live: Aussie dollar surges past three-year high of 70 US cents as greenback tumbles
item.description: The Australian dollar has climbed to its highest level since February 2023 ahead of the latest ABS inflation data, which could further increase the odds of the Reserve Bank lifting interest rates at its policy meeting next week. Follow live.

item.title: Busselton ratepayers set to foot $60 million bill after performing arts centre cost blowout
item.description: Residents demand answers after the cost of a performing arts centre in the state's South West more than tripled its original allocated budget.
